title_sort: sophia williams to walt whitman, 24 november 1890
title: Sophia Williams to Walt Whitman, 24 November 1890
text: 1833 Spruce StreetPhiladelphia.My dear Mr. WhitmanI am asking some friends to take a cup of tea tomorrow (Tuesday afternoon) between four and six o'clock, with miss Gale, the bright young actress who is supporting Booth and Barrett at the Chestnut St. Opera house this week.Would it be possible for you to come. I know she wouldenjoy so much the meeting you and seeing you.If you cannot come as I fear you cannot, she would prize very much a few words of regret from your own hand. If you will send it here, I will see that she gets it.Miss Gale is one of our most, if not our most promising young actorsâ€”Wishing we might have the pleasure of seeing you.Very sincerelySophia Wells Royce Williams Sophia Williams to Walt Whitman, 24 November 1890
